Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="gb2312"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: 7bit

Ok, I see. Yes, this is a little bit complex operation. Will this one be one of those features of Heritrix in the future?
I think this could be useful for article archive project. For example, some websites can have a database to save lots of articles which you need to search by filling a form.

I am interested in some similar websites, so it will be a little be trouble to do it by hand. :)

Thanks a lot, Michael! You are so kind to answer me in so much detail!





Andy
2006-04-19



Re: [archive-crawler] Re: How to crawl form based dynamic webpageswith Heritrix?

Regards the below, Andy wrote me off list clarifying what it is that he 
wants to do.  He wants to be able to POST to arbitrary html forms 
arbitrary data. The example he gave was orbitz.com: filling in a 
designated set of flight cities, number of passengers, etc. (assuming 
robots.txt and 'Terms of Use' allowed crawlers).

We'd have to extend our login so that you could list instead an 
arbitrary set of URLs on a site and an arbitrary set of form data to 
fill in.  First we'd crawl the page with GET and then POST the supplied 
form data.  If we allowed for multiple form sets, we'd do the GET/POST 
cycle for each supplied.  I'd guess that this feature would not be easy 
to implement given the vagaries of how each site does form handling.

Are you only interested in a single site Andy?  Have you tried scripting 
curl or wget or using the http libs in python/perl to get the data you want.

St.Ack


Andy Lee wrote:
> Yes, Michael. I saw the mail. But I still don't know how to do the 
> setting of Heritrix to do that.
> Because there are some name/value pairs I need to assign for the 
> webpages which have forms, an example will be perfect to understand. :)
> Sorry, I am a newbie in this field. I am trying to master it~~~ 
> Heritrix is really great!
>  
>   Best,
>     Andy
>
>

>     > Really thanks a lot!
